blocks.name: axc11n11
blocks.content: Proof of ~ axc11n from { ~ ax-1 -- ~ ax-7 , ~ axc11 } . Almost identical to ~ axc11nfromc11 . (Contributed by NM, 6-Jul-2021.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)

blocks.name: axc11n11r
blocks.content: Proof of ~ axc11n from { ~ ax-1 -- ~ ax-7 , ~ axc9 , ~ axc11r } (note that ~ axc16 is provable from { ~ ax-1 -- ~ ax-7 , ~ axc11r }). Note that ~ axc11n proves (over minimal calculus) that ~ axc11 and ~ axc11r are equivalent. Therefore, ~ axc11n11 and ~ axc11n11r prove that one can use one or the other as an axiom, provided one assumes the axioms listed above ( ~ axc11 appears slightly stronger since ~ axc11n11r requires ~ axc9 while ~ axc11n11 does not). (Contributed by BJ, 6-Jul-2021.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)
blocks.origin:
thm axc11n11r(setvar s0, setvar s1) {
  |- wi(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wal(s1, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0))))
} = {
  pm2.61i(wi(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wal(s1, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)))), wex(hs0, wal(s1, wceq(cv(s1), cv(hs0)))))
  exlimiv(hs0, wal(s1, wceq(cv(s1), cv(hs0))), wi(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wal(s1, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)))))
  spsd(s0, wal(s1, wceq(cv(s1), cv(hs0))), wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wal(s1, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0))))
  syl5(wal(s1, wceq(cv(s1), cv(hs0))), wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wal(s1, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0))), wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)))
  equcomi(s0, s1)
  axc16(s1, hs0, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)))
  sylbir(wn(wex(hs0, wal(s1, wceq(cv(s1), cv(hs0))))), wi(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wal(s1, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)))), wal(hs0, wn(wal(s1, wceq(cv(s1), cv(hs0))))))
  alnex(hs0, wal(s1, wceq(cv(s1), cv(hs0))))
  syl(wal(hs0, wn(wal(s1, wceq(cv(s1), cv(hs0))))), wi(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wal(s1, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)))), wex(hs0, wa(wn(wal(s1, wceq(cv(s1), cv(hs0)))), wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0)))))
  mpan2(wal(hs0, wn(wal(s1, wceq(cv(s1), cv(hs0))))), wex(hs0, wa(wn(wal(s1, wceq(cv(s1), cv(hs0)))), wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0)))), wex(hs0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0))))
  ax6evr(hs0, s0)
  19.29(hs0, wn(wal(s1, wceq(cv(s1), cv(hs0)))), wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0)))
  exlimiv(hs0, wa(wn(wal(s1, wceq(cv(s1), cv(hs0)))), wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0))), wi(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wal(s1, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)))))
  syl6(wa(wn(wal(s1, wceq(cv(s1), cv(hs0)))), wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0))), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wal(s1, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0))), wi(wn(wal(s1, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)))), wal(s1, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)))))
  imp(wn(wal(s1, wceq(cv(s1), cv(hs0)))), wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0)), wi(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wi(wn(wal(s1, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)))), wal(s1, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0))))))
  com24(wn(wal(s1, wceq(cv(s1), cv(hs0)))), wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0)), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wn(wal(s1, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)))), wal(s1, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0))))
  ex(wn(wal(s1, wceq(cv(s1), cv(hs0)))), wn(wal(s1, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)))), wi(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0)), wal(s1, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0))))))
  syl8(wa(wn(wal(s1, wceq(cv(s1), cv(hs0)))), wn(wal(s1, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0))))), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0)), wal(s1, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0))), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0))))
  syl9(wa(wn(wal(s1, wceq(cv(s1), cv(hs0)))), wn(wal(s1, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0))))), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0)), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0))), wal(s1, wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0))))
  impcom(wn(wal(s1, wceq(cv(s1), cv(hs0)))), wn(wal(s1, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)))), wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0)), wal(s1, wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0)))))
  axc9(s1, s0, hs0)
  axc11r(s0, s1, wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0)))
  aev(s0, hs0, s1, s1, s0)
  pm2.18(wal(s1, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0))))
  diff.hs0.w(wi(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wal(s1, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)))))
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
}

blocks.name: bj-axc16g16
blocks.content: Proof of ~ axc16g from { ~ ax-1 -- ~ ax-7 , ~ axc16 }. (Contributed by BJ, 6-Jul-2021.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)

blocks.name: bj-ax12v3
blocks.content: A weak version of ~ ax-12 which is stronger than ~ ax12v . Note that if one assumes reflexivity of equality ` |- x = x ` ( ~ equid ), then ~ bj-ax12v3 implies ~ ax-5 over modal logic K (substitute ` x ` for ` y ` ). See also ~ bj-ax12v3ALT . (Contributed by BJ, 6-Jul-2021.)

blocks.name: bj-ax12v3ALT
blocks.content: Alternate proof of ~ bj-ax12v3 . Uses ~ axc11r and ~ axc15 instead of ~ ax-12 . (Contributed by BJ, 6-Jul-2021.) (Proof modification is discouraged.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: bj-sb
blocks.content: A weak variant of ~ sbid2 not requiring ~ ax-13 nor ~ ax-10 . On top of Tarski's FOL, one implication requires only ~ ax12v , and the other requires only ~ sp . (Contributed by BJ, 25-May-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm bj-sb(setvar s0, setvar s1, wff w0) {
  |- wb(w0, wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wal(s1, wi(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)), w0)))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
} = {
  impbii(w0, wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wal(s1, wi(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)), w0)))))
  alrimiv(s0, w0, wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wal(s1, wi(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)), w0))))
  com12(w0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wal(s1, wi(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)), w0)))
  equcoms(s0, s1, wi(w0, wal(s1, wi(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)), w0))))
  ax12v(s1, s0, w0)
  sylibr(wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wal(s1, wi(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)), w0)))), w0, wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), w0)))
  alimi(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wal(s1, wi(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)), w0))), wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), w0))
  a2i(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wal(s1, wi(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)), w0)), w0)
  equcoms(s0, s1, wi(wal(s1, wi(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)), w0)), w0))
  com12(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wal(s1, wi(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)), w0)), w0)
  sp(s1, wi(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)), w0))
  bj-eqs(s0, s1, w0)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
}

blocks.name: bj-modalbe
blocks.content: The predicate-calculus version of the axiom (B) of modal logic. See also ~ modal-b . (Contributed by BJ, 20-Oct-2019.)

blocks.name: bj-spst
blocks.content: Closed form of ~ sps . Once in main part, prove ~ sps and ~ spsd from it. (Contributed by BJ, 20-Oct-2019.)

blocks.content: Closed form of ~ 19.21bi . (Contributed by BJ, 20-Oct-2019.)

blocks.name: bj-alexbiex
blocks.content: Adding a second quantifier is a tranparent operation, ( ` A. E. ` case). (Contributed by BJ, 20-Oct-2019.)

blocks.name: bj-exexbiex

blocks.name: bj-alalbial
blocks.content: Adding a second quantifier is a tranparent operation, ( ` A. A. ` case). (Contributed by BJ, 20-Oct-2019.)

blocks.name: bj-exalbial
blocks.content: Adding a second quantifier is a tranparent operation, ( ` E. A. ` case). (Contributed by BJ, 20-Oct-2019.)

blocks.name: bj-19.9htbi
blocks.content: Strengthening ~ 19.9ht by replacing its succedent with a biconditional ( ~ 19.9t does have a biconditional succedent). This propagates. (Contributed by BJ, 20-Oct-2019.)

blocks.name: bj-hbntbi
blocks.content: Strengthening ~ hbnt by replacing its succedent with a biconditional. See also ~ hbntg and ~ hbntal . (Contributed by BJ, 20-Oct-2019.) Proved from ~ bj-19.9htbi . (Proof modification is discouraged.)

blocks.name: bj-biexal1
blocks.content: A general FOL biconditional that generalizes ~ 19.9ht among others. For this and the following theorems, see also ~ 19.35 , ~ 19.21 , ~ 19.23 . (Contributed by BJ, 20-Oct-2019.)

blocks.name: bj-biexal2
blocks.content: A general FOL biconditional. (Contributed by BJ, 20-Oct-2019.)

blocks.name: bj-biexal3
blocks.content: A general FOL biconditional. (Contributed by BJ, 20-Oct-2019.)

blocks.name: bj-bialal
blocks.content: A general FOL biconditional. (Contributed by BJ, 20-Oct-2019.)

blocks.name: bj-biexex
blocks.content: A general FOL biconditional. (Contributed by BJ, 20-Oct-2019.)

blocks.name: bj-hbext
blocks.content: Closed form of ~ hbex . (Contributed by BJ, 10-Oct-2019.)
blocks.origin:
thm bj-hbext(setvar s0, setvar s1, wff w0) {
  |- wi(wal(s0, wal(s1, wi(w0, wal(s1, w0)))), wi(wex(s0, w0), wal(s1, wex(s0, w0))))
} = {
  3imtr3g(wal(s0, wal(s1, wi(w0, wal(s1, w0)))), wex(s0, w0), wal(s1, wex(s0, w0)), wn(wal(s0, wn(w0))), wal(s1, wn(wal(s0, wn(w0)))))
  syl(wal(s0, wal(s1, wi(w0, wal(s1, w0)))), wi(wn(wal(s0, wn(w0))), wal(s1, wn(wal(s0, wn(w0))))), wal(s1, wi(wal(s0, wn(w0)), wal(s1, wal(s0, wn(w0))))))
  alrimi(s1, wal(s0, wal(s1, wi(w0, wal(s1, w0)))), wi(wal(s0, wn(w0)), wal(s1, wal(s0, wn(w0)))))
  nfa2(s1, s0, wi(w0, wal(s1, w0)))
  syl(wal(s0, wal(s1, wi(w0, wal(s1, w0)))), wi(wal(s0, wn(w0)), wal(s1, wal(s0, wn(w0)))), wal(s0, wi(wn(w0), wal(s1, wn(w0)))))
  alimi(s0, wal(s1, wi(w0, wal(s1, w0))), wi(wn(w0), wal(s1, wn(w0))))
  hbnt(s1, w0)
  bj-hbalt(s0, s1, wn(w0))
  hbnt(s1, wal(s0, wn(w0)))
  albii(s1, wn(wal(s0, wn(w0))), wex(s0, w0))
  bicomi(wn(wal(s0, wn(w0))), wex(s0, w0))
  df-ex(s0, w0)
}

blocks.name: bj-nfalt

blocks.name: bj-nfext
blocks.content: Closed form of ~ nfex . (Contributed by BJ, 10-Oct-2019.)

blocks.name: bj-eeanvw
blocks.content: Version of ~ exdistrv with a disjoint variable condition on ` x , y ` not requiring ~ ax-11 . (The same can be done with ~ eeeanv and ~ ee4anv .) (Contributed by BJ, 29-Sep-2019.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)

blocks.name: bj-modal4e
blocks.content: Dual statement of ~ hba1 (which is modal-4 ). (Contributed by BJ, 21-Dec-2020.) TODO: in the proof, replace use of ~ hba1 by ~ bj-hba1 which is the standard proof. (Proof modification is discouraged.)

blocks.name: bj-modalb
blocks.content: A short form of the axiom B of modal logic using only primitive symbols ( ` -> , -. , A. ` ). (Contributed by BJ, 4-Apr-2021.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)
